snippet: Cate Jenkins argued that the agency had fired her for accusing it of understating the toxicity of the dust at the Lower Manhattan site.
abstract: Dr Cate Jenkins, senior Environmental Protection Agency chemist who argued that she was removed from her job in retaliation for accusing the agency of underestimating the toxicity of dust at ground zero, is reinstated with back pay; federal Merit Systems Protection Board rules that the agency violated her due process rights.
lead_paragraph: Cate Jenkins argued that the agency had fired her for accusing it of understating the toxicity of the dust at the Lower Manhattan site.

headline.seo: E.P.A. Chemist, Cate Jenkins, Who Warned of Ground Zero Dust Is Reinstated
headline.main: E.P.A. Chemist Who Warned of Ground Zero Dust Is Reinstated
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Chemist Who Warned of Ground Zero Dust Is Reinstated
